chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R. Kutz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay restitution of $200 payable to Christi Ott-(fence of uncharged referral-15-008303)
--To pay restitution of $13.99 payable to Pick n Save, Fort Atkinson (vodka-uncharged referral-15-008994)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee

--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharges
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharges

--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling required per Agent
--To maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No contact with Andrew Porep, Jared Coy, Trevor Schultz or Nickolaus Wiedenhaft
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening at discretion of agent
--Use of an alcohol monitoring bracelet at the discretion of the supervising agent
--Attend school as required by law and have no unexcused absences from school (supervising agent to verify quarterly)
--No illegal possession of tobacco
--Curfew from 6:00 pm until 6:00 am (defendant to be inside his residence from 6:00 pm - 6:00 am) until at least the defendant's 18th birthday (9/23/16); exceptions (eg: employment) must be approved by agent
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Court finds the Defendant will benefit and society will not be harmed and that Mr. Kutz is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Arresting Agency: Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Cases 15CF382, 15CF390 & 15CM484 called together at 10:10 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Matthew R. Kutz in court, in-custody, with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel submits letter from Defendant to the Court; Counsel inform Court that they have no factual disputes with coorespondence from the probation officer
Sentencing Arguments by ADA Beck; off-record: 10:19 - 10:20; Sentencing Arguments by Atty Rhiel
  
15CM484: On Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 8 months in Jefferson County Jail, with NO Huber privileges; to commence consecutive tro another previously imposed sentence
--109 days credit for time already served given
--pay all remaining costs & restitution - to be entered into civil judgment

15CF390: On Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 1 month in Jefferson County Jail, with NO Huber privileges; to commence consecutive to 15CM484

15CF390: On Count #2, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 1 month in Jefferson County Jail, with NO Huber privileges; to commence consecutive to Count #1

15CF390: On Count #5, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 1 month in Jefferson County Jail, with NO Huber privileges; to commence consecutive to Count #2

--38 days credit for time already served given

--As to all counts: costs to be entered into civil judgment

15CF382: On Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 2 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for counseling, AODA treatment, employment and/or educattion; to commence consecutive 15CF390

15CF382: On Count #2, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 1 month in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence consecutive to Count #1

--1 days credit for time already served given
--As to all counts: costs & restitution to be entered into civil judgment
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system;  non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/Work-Release privileges without further process.
Recess: 10:46 am
Attorney John Rhiel
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

[MK] cases #15CF385, #15CF390, #15CM484 called at 11:52am. 
Defendant Matthew R. Kutz in court, in custody.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DOC Agent Paul Hasenstab is present. 
The Court addresses right to counsel with Mr. Kutz. Mr. Kutz indicates that he intends to contact the Public Defender. However then the Court and parties discuss that there is not a revocation being considered at this time.
Mr. Hasenstab clarifies that his correspondence was sent to draw the Court's attention to the fact that Mr. Kutz is not following the Court-ordered conditions of his Probation. Agent Hasenstab informs the Court that a 45 day jail-sanction has now been imposed. 
The Court speaks with Mr. Kutz about his non-compliance and the concerns related to housing upon release; it is agreed by all that it is best for Mr. Kutz not to reside in his father's house. Agent Hasenstab will continue efforts regarding arrangements for Mr. Kutz to reside with a different family member upon his release from the jail sanction term.
recess 12:03pm.

Cases 15CF382, 15CF390 & 15CM484 called together at 1:54 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Matthew R. Kutz in court, in-custody, with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #1-15CF382 to 943.23(4m)-Operate a MV without Owners Consent-Passenger, a Class A Misdemeanor
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #2-15CF390 to 946.49(1)(a)-Misdemeanor Bail-Jumping, a Class A Misdemeanor
ADA Teuber submits victim impact statement for 15CF390

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Cts#1 & #2-15CF382, Cts#1, #2 & #5-15CF390 & Ct#1-15CM484; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Remaining Counts in 15CF382, 15CF390 & 15CM484
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses uncharged referrals: Fort Atkinson PD Case#2015-008303 DOV: 10/19/15 Charge (1) Disorderly Conduct [947.01(1)] (2) Resisting an Officer [946.41(1)], (3) Criminal Damage to Property [943.01(1)]. AND Fort Atkinson PD Case #2015-008994 DOV: 11/11/15 Charge (1) Retail Theft [943.50(1m)(b) & (4)(a)].
off-record: 2:19 - 2:20 pm - ADA Teuber informs the Court that Mr. Kutz remains on supervision so would have assistance through human services with housing if needed

On Cts#1 & #2-15CF382, Cts#1, #2 & #5-15CF390 & Ct#1-15CM484, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 33 months, with conditions:
--The Court orders 2 days jail (Ct#2-15CF390), with no Huber, to commence forthwith.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling required per Agent
--To maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No contact with Andrew Porep, Jared Coy, Trevor Schultz or Nickolaus Wiedenhaft
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening at discretion of agent
--Use of an alcohol monitoring bracelet at the discretion of the supervising agent
--Attend school as required by law and have no unexcused absences from school (supervising agent to verify quarterly)
--No illegal possession of tobacco
--Curfew from 6:00 pm until 6:00 am (defendant to be inside his residence from 6:00 pm - 6:00 am) until at least the defendant's 18th birthday (9/23/16); exceptions (eg: employment) must be approved by agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharges
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution of $20.55 payable to Kwik Trip, Fort Atkinson-Ct#2-15CF382
--To pay restitution of $500 payable to Charlene Zimmerman-Ct#1-15CM484
--To pay restitution of $200 payable to Christi Ott-(fence of uncharged referral-15-008303)-15CF382-Ct#1
--To pay restitution of $13.99 payable to Pick n Save, Fort Atkinson (vodka-uncharged referral-15-008994)-15CF382-Ct#1
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee

Court finds the Defendant will benefit and society will not be harmed and that Mr. Kutz is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation

[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Matthew R. Kutz in court, in-custody, with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CM484:
Atty Rhiel informs the Court that he has not yet been appointed on 15CM484, but likely will be
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Pleas of "Not Guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by Defendant 

15CF382: On State's Motion to Modify Bond:
Arguments presented by Counsel - Court grants motion to modify bond and requires a $500 CASH bond, with conditions:
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No contact with Andrew Porep 
(* Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-Daily Curfew of 6:00 pm - 6:00 am - Must be in residence during those times except for work purposes

15CM484: 
Court requires a $500 CASH bond, with conditions:
-Booking at JESO

Atty Rhiel informs the Court that there is resolution on felony matters and do believe that could include misdemeanor file, requests that all matters be set before the Court as soon as possible for status, which would be anticipated plea on felony matters and likely misdemeanor file as well.
